The right time to eat dinner in winter for better digestion and sleep
description: Winter's shorter days disrupt circadian rhythms, impacting metabolism and sleep. Shifting calories to earlier meals and opting for lighter evening fare supports overall well-being during colder months.

Self-employment is creating most new jobs in India: What this means for job seekers
description: Self-employment has emerged as the fastest-growing segment in India’s labour market, rising from 23.9 crore in FY18 to 35.8 crore in FY24. It now accounts for over half of India’s total employment, with growth seen across both farm and non-farm sectors. Students and young professionals are exploring opportunities in freelancing, digital services, traditional businesses, and agricultural entrepreneurship. The trend highlights the need for skill development, entrepreneurial preparedness, and supportive policies to sustain independent work as formal jobs grow slowly.

description: The Supreme Court questioned the validity of Muslim men authorizing lawyers to issue Talaq-e-Hasan notices, deeming it a practice that leaves women vulnerable. The bench stressed that divorce requires the husband's direct pronouncement and signature, not delegation to third parties. This judicial scrutiny brings renewed attention to the constitutional validity of this divorce method.

title: Cardi B inspires Stefon Diggs as Patriots WR battles painful ACL recovery

Now signed with the Patriots, his journey highlights the crucial role of mental resilience and personal encouragement in professional sports.

description: The Trump administration may delay imposing promised semiconductor tariffs, signaling a cautious approach to avoid provoking China and disrupting rare earth mineral supplies. While the White House denies a policy shift, reports suggest a potential postponement amid domestic concerns over rising consumer prices and a fragile trade truce with Beijing.

Raid on Kashmir Times office: Cops recover AK rifle cartridges, bullets; editors react
description: Jammu and Kashmir Police's State Investigation Agency raided the Jammu office of Kashmir Times. Officials stated the publication was involved in activities against the country. The search recovered AK rifle cartridges, pistol rounds, and hand-grenade pins. The newspaper management called the allegations baseless and an attempt to "silence independent journalism."

With both teams looking to gain momentum, Tavares’ availability could shape the outcome, especially with Toronto’s offense driving their early-season success. description: Former NFL star Antonio Brown emerged from a Miami correctional center, facing attempted murder charges. Prosecutors and his defense attorney expressed doubts about the alleged victim being shot, potentially impacting the case. Brown, who pleaded not guilty, was granted house arrest with a GPS monitor, allowing him to work and support his seven children.

title: Chip race: Semiconductor sector will be on par with US by 2032, says Vaishnaw
description: India aims to rival global chipmaking leaders like the US and China within a decade, with plans advancing rapidly. The government's $10 billion incentive scheme is foundational, fostering manufacturing, assembly, and design capacity. By 2031-2032, India expects to achieve parity with current global leaders, leveraging its engineering talent and design capabilities.

title: How anti-India hate went mainstream in America - offline and online
description: A community once welcomed as quiet achievers is now facing a bipartisan backlash, as anti-India hate jumps from online narratives to real-world hostility in a country still misreading Indians five centuries after Columbus.

description: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak strongly defended head coach Gautam Gambhir against criticism following the Kolkata Test loss to South Africa. "'Gautam Gambhir, Gautam Gambhir' (criticism) is being done. I am saying this because I am a staff and I feel bad. That's not the way," Kotak said on Thursday ahead of the second Test starting Saturday.

Humanoid robots, like Tesla's Optimus, could become the largest industry. This technological leap may also eliminate poverty and make everyone wealthy. Musk suggests money's relevance could diminish as resources become abundant through automation.

title: Gold and silver ETFs losing shine — Should you buy on dip or hold back?
description: Gold and silver ETFs experienced a significant downturn, with gold down over 6% and silver nearly 9%. Experts advise a long-term perspective and systematic investment plans (SIPs) to navigate volatility. While gold is seen as a debt alternative, silver's long-term potential is viewed as weaker. Despite recent dips, both metals show strong historical returns.

The probe has expanded internationally, involving Saudi Arabia, Maldives, and Turkey.

description: Governors cannot indefinitely delay Bills passed by state legislatures, the Supreme Court ruled, emphasizing cooperative federalism. However, courts cannot set hard deadlines for governors or the President on Bills, nor can they grant 'deemed assent' or compel the President to seek judicial opinions. The ruling clarifies the limits of judicial intervention while upholding constitutional accountability.

Don’t ignore these 5 subtle heart-failure indicators, including cough at night

Dr. Dmitry Yaranov stresses that recognizing these early warning signs is crucial for prompt medical care, effective management, and preventing serious complications, ultimately improving long-term heart health and quality of life.

Top neuroscientist reveals the best supplement for brain health, that also improves sleep
description: Neuroscientist Robert Love highlights magnesium as a crucial supplement for optimal brain health and sleep.  This essential mineral supports hundreds of biochemical reactions vital for cognition, memory, and focus.  Magnesium threonate and glycinate are recommended forms for enhancing brain function and promoting restful sleep.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has appointed Rolf Harms, the executive behind the influential 2010 "Economics of the Cloud" white paper, to help rethink Microsoft's business model for the AI era. In an internal memo obtained by Business Insider, Nadella emphasized the need to rapidly transform the company's approach to AI economics, similar to its cloud computing pivot 15 years ago. The move reflects Nadella's concerns about Microsoft's survival in the AI era, as he warned employees that some of the company's biggest businesses may become irrelevant without fundamental changes.

title: 5 signs you are not healthy, according to a top doc
description: Dr. William Li highlights five critical bodily signs often ignored until they become severe. These include blood in stool, saliva, urine, on the skin without injury, and abnormal vaginal bleeding. Prompt medical attention for these symptoms is vital for early detection and potentially life-saving treatment, as they can indicate serious conditions like cancer.

title: Candace Owens drops explosive claim on Charlie Kirk ‘assassination’
description: Candace Owens questions the official narrative surrounding Charlie Kirk's shooting, suggesting a planned setup involving multiple individuals. She claims Tyler Robinson's role was limited, with his fingerprints not being the only ones on the weapon. Owens also alleges Lance Twiggs played a more significant, albeit different, part in the incident, citing a TMZ video as evidence.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs’ role in violent elevator encounter
description: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: Analysts frustrated with Nylander as Leafs lead without Auston Matthews
description: William Nylander faces criticism for his inconsistent play as he leads the Toronto Maple Leafs in Auston Matthews' absence. Analysts question his commitment to a two-way game, citing recent defensive lapses. Despite strong offensive numbers, his impact is under scrutiny. The team's defensive struggles are also a major concern, with forwards expected to contribute more defensively.
